title:Pandapaxxy S23 Dreaming City Weapons
description:https://www.reddit.com/r/sharditkeepit/comments/18urqqa/season_23_dreaming_city_weapons/

// Tigerspite
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Tigerspite is one of those guns that despite not having the best perks, the best stats, or even the best model; something about it feels phenomenal. I enjoy almost every Tigerspite I use, and I am excited to get more of them. Kinetic Tremors, Frenzy, or Kill Clip will depend on your activity and favorite damage boost. Pair it with your favorite reload or reload bypassing perk and you’ve got a dependable workhorse auto that just feels like bliss." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=2465372924&perks=839105230,1087426260,1168162263,3891536761

// Tigerspite
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Tigerspite now has a better glow-up for PvP. Fragile Focus is great for starting an engagement but will quickly lose its value the longer you’re in a gunfight. Moving Target is neutrally good for providing a better strafe speed and some much needed aim assist. I prefer Kill Clip in the final column to lower my TtK requirements in subsequent kills, but if you’re going to take this into Trials or 3v3 game modes, Eye of the Storm might be better for its consistency duel to duel." Recommened MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=2465372924&perks=3250034553,1885400500,2451262963,1015611457

// Retold Tale
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Retold Tale is not a PvE shotgun. It does come with some nice PvE perks like One-Two Punch, but the lack of Grave Robber lowers it in my opinion. Destabilizing Rounds and Repulsor Brace have good synergy but on a shotgun I’d rather take a good damage perk over an add clearing one." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Retold Tale
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Retold Tale was and still is one of my favorite shotguns. I used it a ton before getting my best Mindbender’s Ambition. I still prefer the U shaped sights on Retold. I grinded out a decent Compass Rose with QuickDraw and Snapshot Sights, so we will see if Retold will be better. I think most players will still opt for a Matador but having a super snappy shotgun won’t hurt your vault space too much (though seeing the state of your vault it might be a tough squeeze /s)." Recommended MW: Handling or Range.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Twilight Oath
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Similarly to Retold Tale, Twilight Oath has PvE perks but not the best position. Envious Assassin is great for overfilling the magazine, and Vorpal Weapon will net you great damage. You can utilize the full extent of Precision Instrument, my biggest issue is the frame. Rapid-fire frame snipers are hard to utilize at max RPM and require a hard pull down to keep on target. With the crit box shrinking on some bosses and champions doing what champions want to do, it will be hard to continuously hit crits at max RPM. Otherwise it’s a pretty solid general use sniper." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=1874424704&perks=839105230,1087426260,968510818,1546637391

// Twilight Oath
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "All of the Dreaming City weapons have a special place in my heart. Twilight Oath is no exception, it was the sniper I mained until Revoker came out. I never used a Snapshot Sights and Opening Shot roll, but I think it would be fun. You’re going to need to split your stat investments between handling and range to make sure you can feel that 70 aim assist on those longer sightlines." Recommended MW: Range or Handling.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=1874424704&perks=839105230,3142289711,47981717,957782887

// Vouchsafe
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Vouchsafe returns but has lost a bit of its edge. It used to be a really good void scout, comparable to Night Watch. And while Night Watch has still kept some of its relevance over the years, Doom of Chelchis has overtaken Vouchsafe for the best in slot weapon. Vouchsafe does retain some great perks in Rapid Hit and Explosive Payload, while also adding in great perks like Repulsor Brace and Golden Tricorn. It might not be the ultimate best weapon, but it also doesn’t require any raiding." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Vouchsafe
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / Controller): "Lightweight frames in PvP are in an interesting spot. They don’t kill fast enough to be competitive, and any boosts don’t really elevate the weapon further. Golden Tricorn 2x does allow you to 3 shot any guardian at any resilience at a 0.60 TtK, but it requires two whole kills to get rolling and without additional ability kills you’ll be back at square one before you know it. Taraxippos and Eternal Blazon with Kill Clip or even Tarnished Mettle with Swashbuckler allow you to 3 crit after just one kill." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pvp,controller
dimwishlist:item=355922321&perks=839105230,3177308360,247725512,3038247973
dimwishlist:item=355922321&perks=3661387068,3177308360,247725512,3038247973
dimwishlist:item=355922321&perks=839105230,3230963543,247725512,3038247973
dimwishlist:item=355922321&perks=3661387068,3230963543,247725512,3038247973
dimwishlist:item=355922321&perks=839105230,3177308360,588594999,3038247973
dimwishlist:item=355922321&perks=3661387068,3177308360,588594999,3038247973
dimwishlist:item=355922321&perks=839105230,3230963543,588594999,3038247973
dimwishlist:item=355922321&perks=3661387068,3230963543,588594999,3038247973


// Vouchsafe
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Lightweight frames in PvP are in an interesting spot. They don’t kill fast enough to be competitive, and any boosts don’t really elevate the weapon further. Golden Tricorn 2x does allow you to 3 shot any guardian at any resilience at a 0.60 TtK, but it requires two whole kills to get rolling and without additional ability kills you’ll be back at square one before you know it. Taraxippos and Eternal Blazon with Kill Clip or even Tarnished Mettle with Swashbuckler allow you to 3 crit after just one kill." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pvp,mkb
dimwishlist:item=355922321&perks=1482024992,3177308360,247725512,3038247973
dimwishlist:item=355922321&perks=1482024992,3230963543,247725512,3038247973
dimwishlist:item=355922321&perks=1482024992,3177308360,588594999,3038247973
dimwishlist:item=355922321&perks=1482024992,3230963543,588594999,3038247973


// Waking Vigil
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Let’s talk about power creep. When Waking Vigil released it was a phenomenal arc hand cannon. Outclassed by Nation of Beasts for the best arc hand cannon. With its midlife refresh Waking Vigil was blessed with a reload perk and an AoE perk through Dragonfly. However it was still overshadowed by Nation of Beasts and by then Ancient Gospel. When the hand cannon merger happened, Waking Vigil lost its only claim to fame being a Lightweight hand cannon versus the aforementioned adaptives. While we still have some great perks going on currently, Waking Vigil is just a relic from the past." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Abide the Return
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "What a missed opportunity for an underutilized sword to have a specific niche. How interesting would it be if Bungie introduced a double zoom sword. Valiant Charge and Eager Edge. Swap to the sword for your first zoom, block on your way for a second. Be able to zoom In two different directions or one direction for a huge zoooom. Without that it falls into a large category of underused adaptive frame swords." Recommended MW: Impact.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Sleepless
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Sleepless is an interesting rocket. It was great when rockets could be used everywhere and when we didn’t have to reload via Lunafaction Boots or Rally Barricades. Currently you’ll find very limited uses out of most rockets. There are a few options that have risen to the top, but it means most rockets are going to fall into general utility tools. Sleepless has Chain Reaction for better add clear, and Auto-Loading Holster for quality of life. You might be able to squeeze out some solid DPS with Field Prep but without a good damage perk you’ll fall behind almost immediately." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Sleepless
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Crucible rockets need one thing, a great blast radius. Sleepless has that in droves. With a blast radius masterwork you’ll sit at 100 even, that way you can invest your other perks into velocity and handling, bringing up some of its lower stats. With Quick Launch and High-Velocity Rounds you’re looking at a nice 60 velocity. It won’t beat Impulse Amplifier for the quickest rocket but it will move. Chain Reaction then becomes great for dealing with multiple guardians in every gamemode." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=2140635451&perks=3525010810,2822142346,3977735242,2396489472
